alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Muskingum; Noble; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:02PM EDT until April 05 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR GUERNSEY...COSHOCTON...MUSKINGUM...SOUTHWESTERN TUSCARAWAS AND NORTHERN NOBLE COUNTIES... At 602 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Frazeysburg to South Zanesville to near Perry State Forest, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, Coshocton, Cambridge, Newcomerstown, New Concord, Byesville, West Lafayette, South Zanesville, North Zanesville, Dresden, Frazeysburg, and Antrim. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
